intro: Lasiospermum pedunculare, commonly known as the slender hair-leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves with hairy surfaces, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with long, silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
